"This hearing will be an important opportunity to shed light on critical consumer data privacy issues and help all Americans better understand what happens to their personal information online," said Reps. Greg Walden, an Oregon Republican, and Frank Pallone, a New Jersey Democrat.

Facebook's FB, -1.58% Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg will testify before the House Energy and Commerce Committee on April 11 about the company's use and protection of user data, lawmakers said Wednesday.
Facebook has admitted user data were improperly obtained by data-analytics firm Cambridge Analytica.
